Package com.palomamobile.android.sdk.auth

The Auth SDK module is not normally called directly from client apps.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAuthManager
    This interface is normally NOT of interest to Application developers unless you are intending to extend or modify the SDK functionality.
    Implementing classes provide access to Client and User access tokens that are required when accessing authenticated Paloma Services over network.
    IAuthService
    IAuthService provides API calls to retrieve Client and User tokens.
    IUserCredential
    User credentials used to authenticate the user and get their User AccessToken.
    IUserCredentialsProvider
    Implementing class provides user credentials used for authentication with the Paloma Mobile platform.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AccessToken
    Defines an access token (client or user) as implemented by PalomaMobile for OAuth2.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AuthType
    Enumeration of the possible OAuth2 authentication types.
    IAuthManager.TokenRetrievalMode
    Specifies the token retrieval options.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CredentialsProviderMissingException
    Indicates illegal state of the SDK, the call to IAuthManager.setUserCredentialsProvider(IUserCredentialsProvider) was not made prior to making networked SDK calls that require a user access token.

Package com.palomamobile.android.sdk.auth Description

The Auth SDK module is not normally called directly from client apps. It is required by other SDK modules in order to authenticate their server API calls.

At a high level the Auth SDK supports the following functionality:

  • OAuth2 Client authentication for Client/App functionality such as registering a new user
  • OAuth2 User authentication for User functionality such as sending a message to another user
